metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1126 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: WebKit, as used in Apple iOS before 8.3 and Apple Safari before 6.2.5, 7.x before 7.1.5, and 8.x before 8.0.5, does not properly handle the userinfo field in FTP URLs, which allows remote attackers to trigger incorrect resource access via unspecified vectors.

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'no update available').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
